intro: Argyrolobium rupestre subsp. rupestre, commonly known as the silverleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky areas and along coastal regions. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for rock gardens and drought-tolerant landscapes.
